turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about In Death technology.
turn.2: Knives (switchblades in particular) are commonplace in crime-ridden neighborhoods, and are called "stickers".
turn.4: Close hits at high power, even on stun, can cause temporary or permanent nerve damage, chronic pain, paralysis and/or parasthesia.
turn.6: The lethal setting must be intentionally set immediately before use.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Organ Replacement: Almost any organ can be replaced using synthetic replacements, although some people, due to religious reasons or intolerance to synthetics, turn to human donors, usually cadavers.
turn.10: There is a small traffic in black-market organs, but synthetics limit this.
turn.11: What do you find most interesting about this article?
turn.12: Patrol Stunner: Patrol officers do not carry weapons with an explicit "lethal" setting, but maximum power hits at close proximity to throat or brain can be lethal, but usually only with multiple hits and deliberate intent.
